agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that partners with local human service organizations, businesses, and government agencies to support and strengthen the community.
service_description: Solicits individual and corporate donations to fund and support partner agencies and programs that address human service needs in Franklin County. All assistance is provided through partnering agencies; no direct services are provided through this agency.
site_details: Human service agencies and individuals wishing to make donations, call or walk in for information. -- Persons seeking assistance or wishing to access services funded by United Way, call 2-1-1.
site_schedule: Mon and Thurs 9am-3pm; Tues and Wed 9am-5pm
site_eligibility: Human services agencies in Franklin County

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the town of Brookville in Franklin County.
service_description: Provides trash pick-up, residential recycling, and water and sanitary sewer utility services for the town of Brookville in Franklin County.
site_details: Call for assistance. Bills may be paid in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is located at this address.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Brookville in Franklin County

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the town of Brookville in Franklin County.
service_description: Provides street and sidewalk maintenance, storm-sewer maintenance, snow and ice control, street-sign maintenance, mosquito control, and groundskeeping of public properties and park facilities in the city of Brookville in Franklin County.
site_details: Walk in to visit the parks; Call for information or to submit a request or make a report about street maintenance.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8:30am-noon and 1pm-4pm-- VaryParks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted
Mon-Fri 8:30am-noon and 1pm-4pm-- VaryParks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Brookville in Franklin County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. --  Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Blooming Grove, Brookville, Fairfield, Laurel, Metamora, or Posey Township of Franklin County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. -- Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Blooming Grove, Brookville, Fairfield, Laurel, Metamora or Posey Township of Franklin County

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers activities for older adults, including special interest classes, social activities, travel, and field trips.
service_description: Offers activities for older adults, including special interest classes, social activities, travel, and field trips.
site_details: Walk in or call for information.
site_eligibility: Open -- Age 55 or older

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at www.vitalchek.com; this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Brookville in Franklin County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Brookville in Franklin County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Franklin County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Brookville in Franklin County

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call or email for information.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: Provides parenting education and baby supplies for all in need.
service_description: Offers maternity clothes, baby and children's clothing, diapers, baby food, toys, bedding, and infant care supplies for families in need.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Franklin County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification,   call the prosecutor's office to schedule an appointment. For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance -- Living in Franklin County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities, administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration, issues marriage licenses and records state tax liens in Franklin County.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Franklin County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Franklin County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Thurs 8am-4pm; Fri 8am-noon -- Board Meetings: Weekly every other Tues 10am
Office: Mon-Thurs 8am-4pm; Fri 8am-noon -- Board Meetings: Weekly every other Tues 10am
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: A church with worship services that provides financial assistance for rent, utilities, and other miscellaneous needs to families in need.
service_description: Provides financial assistance for rent and utilities to families in need; maximum utility assistance is $50.
site_details: Call to schedule appointment.
site_eligibility: Haven't received assistance in past 6 months

agency_desc: Oversees housing and commercial development and enforces zoning ordinances for Franklin County.
service_description: Oversees housing and commercial development and enforces zoning ordinances for Franklin County. This department issues permits and conducts inspections for construction and remodeling projects, and handles zoning requests, complaints, and appeals.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing a range of mental health and addiction treatment services for Franklin, Ohio, Ripley, and Switzerland County.
service_description: Provides assessment and outpatient counseling and treatment for people with substance abuse issues and their families. Intensive outpatient services are available.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call the office for an initial assessment.
site_eligibility: Living in Dearborn, Franklin, Ohio, Ripley, or Switzerland County

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides food to people in need. Open service area. Accepts donations for the food pantry and other outreach programs.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open, limit one visit per two weeks

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Franklin County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 or Franklin County Dispatch
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Franklin County)

agency_desc: A commercial business that provides medical care for minor emergencies, illnesses, physicals, and work injuries.
service_description: Offers a walk-in clinic for minor injuries and illnesses, standard health tests and screenings, immunizations, drug screenings, and physicals for school, sports, or work.
site_details: Walk in -OR- go to website to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open; patients age 18 or younger must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian

agency_desc: A government agency offering recycling services.
site_name: SOUTHEASTERN INDIANA RECYCLING DISTRICT - FRANKLIN COUNTY
service_description: Provides a drop-off center for recycling paper, cardboard, newspapers, magazines, plastic bottles and jugs (#1-#2), glass, and aluminum/steel cans. This site also has a reuse center where donations of working equipment/tools, household appliances and goods, clothing, books, toys, and other items are offered to anyone at no charge.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information. -- Walk in to drop off approved recyclables. -- Walk in to browse available items in reuse center; take whatever is needed.
site_schedule: Recycling: Mon-Sat 8:30am-3pm -- Reuse: Tues and Thurs 9am-3pm; Sat 9am-noon
Recycling: Mon-Sat 8:30am-3pm -- Reuse: Tues and Thurs 9am-3pm; Sat 9am-noon
Recycling: Mon-Sat 8:30am-3pm -- Reuse: Tues and Thurs 9am-3pm; Sat 9am-noon
Recycling: Mon-Sat 8:30am-3pm -- Reuse: Tues and Thurs 9am-3pm; Sat 9am-noon
Recycling: Mon-Sat 8:30am-3pm -- Reuse: Tues and Thurs 9am-3pm; Sat 9am-noon
site_eligibility: Open; serves Franklin County

agency_desc: Provides a system of care that strives to help children, youth, and families function better at home, in school, in the community, and throughout life.
service_description: Offers free, monthly, parent-led get-togethers, both in person and online,  that encourage parents to openly talk about the difficulties of being a parent and share ways to strengthen their families. Provides an opportunity for parents and caregivers to learn from other parents in a fun, supportive atmosphere. Offers free child care and a meal.
site_details: Call or email to pre-register to attend.
site_eligibility: Persons caring for a child

agency_name: BATESVILLE AREA MINISTERIAL ASSOCIATION FOOD PANTRY
agency_desc: Fellowship of religious organizations offering community outreach programs to persons in need.
site_name: BATESVILLE AREA MINISTERIAL ASSOCIATION FOOD PANTRY
service_description: Provides emergency assistance for rent, utilities, and prescriptions.
site_details: Call to leave a voicemail with contact information to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Eligibility is determined on a case by case basis

agency_desc: A nonprofit health center focused on providing for the health and wellness needs of the medically uninsured residents of Franklin and Ripley Counties.
service_description: Provides free general medical and dental care for qualifying children and adults.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for more information.
site_eligibility: Open -- Without health insurance -- At or below 275% of the current Federal Poverty Level
